Title: Online WSET Level 1 Award in Wines with Palate Calibration Kit and Video Library
Description:
VIEW PROMO VIDEO

Online Course with the WSET and Southeastern Beverage Education! This course runs four weeks from the start date. We can enroll you in these course on a rolling basis.

No other provider of WSET Online Wine courses offers what Southeastern Beverage Education offers. In addition to the excellent modules and studyguide that WSET has created on their Digital Campus, we supplement this with our Palate Calibration tasting kit sent directly to you, a bank of instructional videos from our video library, and access to the highest-quality wine tasting kits through Master The World. The palate-calibrating tasting kit will save you hours searching for, procuring, and measuring the necessary substances asked for in the course. Included are all the unique substances you need to fully understand your palate’s thresholds for the fundamental tastes in wines. Sugar, Acid, PTC Strip, MSG, thorough instructions, and a tasting mat are all included. When you receive your kit, open it up, and follow the instructions included, as you cue up the corresponding videos to guide you through these fun activities.

The videos will guide you through the exercises as if you were taking the in-person versions of our classes. We walk with you through the content featured throughout the online course, but with our particularly insightful take on this material. Supplementary videos will broaden your experience beyond the curriculum.

We have partnered with Master the World tasting kits to give you access to the highest-quality WSET-focused wine samples that will cover most of the required wines you need to taste while taking the online course. This kit is $100, and you will be given a code to have the kit shipped to you.

Online courses are taught through the WSET Digital Learning portal. Your textbook is provided digitally. The student is expected to obtain appropriate wines for the course. You have the option to purchase a Wine Tasting Kit from Master the World at checkout. Their kit contains 6 wines, which is over half of the 10 wines that you should taste. Southeastern Beverage Education will provide support and administer the exam for the course.

REFUNDS: Payments in full are due at the time of registration for the course, payable through the website. All courses are non-refundable, but you may transfer to another class up to three (3) weeks before the START of the course, and secure a spot in another course for no additional charge. All transfer requests must be received by email. Transfer requests received after this time will not be accepted. Specification for this Qualification

REASONABLE ADJUSTMENT: Please inform us at the time of booking if you require reasonable adjustment for the examination. SEBEVED strives to set up ALL candidates for success. Please contact us by email so that we may assist you: phillip@sebeved.com

Before signing up, please read our Policies

Also, download the Specification for this Qualification to understand the scope of this course.

Title: Online WSET Level 3 Award in Spirits
Description:
This Online Level 3 Award in Spirits class will be held ONLINE through the WSET Digital Learning Platform and through Southeastern Beverage Education. There are 4 courses offered this year: August 5-October 6, 2024; November 11, 2024-January 19, 2025; February 24, 2025- April 27, 2025; and June 2, 2025- August 3 2025. Registration closes four weeks before the start of the course so we have time to get you enrolled, send you a study packet, confirm the date for your exam and for the Online Tasting Calibration day.

You will take the exam with SEBEVED in Nashville, TN two weeks after the conclusion of the Online course. Exam dates for 2024-2025 are: September 21, 2024; October 20, 2024; February 2, 2025; May 10, 2025; August 24, 2025. Online tasting calibration days will take place the Monday from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM Central Time after the conclusion of the Online course: October 7, 2024; January 20, 2025; April 28, 2025; August 4, 2025. You will need to source around 12 spirits for this tasting day. There will be a short break for lunch in the middle of the day.

REFUNDS: Payments in full are due at the time of registration for the course, payable through the website. All courses are non-refundable, but you may transfer to another class up to three (3) weeks before the START of the course, and secure a spot in another course for no additional charge. Title: Online WSET Level 3 Award in Wines
Description:
This Online Level 3 Award in Wines class will be held ONLINE through the WSET Digital Learning Platform. The enrollment is rolling for these classes, so please select a date at least four weeks into the future so we have time to get you enrolled, and send you a study packet.

The Online course takes 9 weeks from the start date. Over this period, you will access the Digital Campus when you are able, as all learning is asynchronous. You should access the campus at least a few times a week, and respond to the instructor’s queries. You will be asked to submit tasting notes for the wines as outlined in the Specification on a regular basis as you progress through the course.

You will take the exam with SEBEVED in person in Nashville, TN within a year of the completion of the course. Please contact us to schedule this, and the options that exist for taking the exam.

REFUNDS: Payments in full are due at the time of registration for the course, payable through the website. All courses are non-refundable, but you may transfer to another class up to three (3) weeks before the START of the course, and secure a spot in another course for no additional charge. All transfer requests must be received by email. Transfer requests received after this time will not be accepted.

Before signing up, please read our Policies

Also, download the Specification for this Qualification to understand the scope of this course.

Title: Palate Calibration Tasting Kit
Description:
Southeastern Beverage Education will send you a kit that will make your journey through the WSET Level One Award in Wines online course a breeze.

Included in this kit are the acid and sugar ingredients to make your tasting solutions, monosodium glutamate, a PTC strip, a tasting mat, and detailed instructions on how to use everything that is included.

With this kit, you’ll be able to participate in the activities as prescribed in the digital campus, and you can follow along with our instructional videos as you taste through the sugar acid solutions, learn about your susceptibility to bitterness, and taste how glutamic acid reacts on your pallet.

Title: Master the World Wine Samples Kit for Level 1 Wines
Description: This kit will be sent directly to you from Master the World Wine Kits. It includes 6 wines that will get you well on your way towards fulfilling the requirements of the necessary wines you should taste for the Online Level 1 Award in Wines course.

Title: In-Person WSET Level 3 Award in Wines | January-February 2025 8:30 am to 5:00 pm
Description:
This WSET Level 3 Award in Wines In-Person class is a 4 weekend course designed for wine professionals. Three modules per day, and tastings to accompany each module. Dates are: January 11, 12, February 1, 2, and 8, with the exam on February 16 at 11:00 am. Classes will be held Nashville.

Each session will include a tasting of wines. Nearly 80 wines will be tasted in this course.

This qualification has a minimum requirement of 84 hours of study time, including 30 hours of classroom time with Southeastern Beverage Education. One should plan to study 50 hours, with the bulk of this study before the start of the course.

REFUNDS: Payments in full are due at the time of registration for the course, payable through the website. All courses are non-refundable, but you may transfer to another class up to three (3) weeks before the START of the course, and secure a spot in another course for no additional charge.
